movie_title: Bitter food, better health? ⏲️ 6 Minute English
introduction: Could bitter foods be better for your health? Beth and Phil discuss this and teach you some useful n

vocabulary.definition: having a sharp, pungent taste or smell; not sweet
vocabulary.example: I find grapefruit too bitter for my liking.

vocabulary.definition: the collection of micro-organisms found in a specific part of the body
vocabulary.example: Research shows that the gut microbiome plays a crucial role in digestion.

vocabulary.definition: to prevent something from happening or operating
vocabulary.example: Bitter foods can suppress feelings of hunger.

vocabulary.definition: not wanted or considered to be good
vocabulary.example: Bitterness is often seen as an undesirable trait in food.

vocabulary.definition: ordinary and widely accepted or used by most people
vocabulary.example: Chocolate and coffee are mainstream foods enjoyed by many.

vocabulary.definition: a small, but noticeable amount of something
vocabulary.example: Alcohol has a degree of bitterness that adds to its flavor profile.
